docs.title: 1. Introduction and Goals
docs.text: Openclass is helping students keeping track of their assignments, tasks and tests.

docs.title: 1.1 Requirements Overview
docs.text:
• Students with the required permissions can add, manage and delete items on the assignments list of a specific class.
  • Students can comment on an item, for example to share summaries or ask for help.
  • Administrators can add new people to a class.
  • Administrators can manage roles and permissions of students and classes.
  • Administrators can create new classes.
  • Administrators can manage the subjects of a class.

docs.title: 2. Constraints
docs.text:
Openclass shall be...

  • open source and licensed under a such license
  • only use open-source technologies, libraries and dependencies
  • runnable in Docker
  • well documented and commented

docs.title: 3.2 Technical Context
docs.text: Openclass is independent from any other system. Openclass runs in a Docker container. Therefore it is independent from the operating system of the server it is hosted on.

docs.title: 4. Solution Strategy
docs.text:
MongoDB is used as the database to persist data. It was chosen because it has more flexibility and we wanted to learn something new.

In the backend, TypeScript is used. It is typesafe but flexible at the same time.

The frontend will be made with ReactJS on a TypeScript basis.
